metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6329 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
OpenVPN, when using a 64-bit block cipher, makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain cleartext data via a birthday attack against a long-duration encrypted session, as demonstrated by an HTTP-over-OpenVPN session using Blowfish in CBC mode, aka a "Sweet32" attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvpn - 2.4.0-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> openvpn 2.3 and earlier use BF-CBC by default unless the cipher is specified manually. 2.3.12 was modified to display a warning if a 64-bit cipher is selected. Since this is just a warning, downgrading priority to low sbeattie> fixed in 2.4.0

criterions.comment: openvpn package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.0-4ubuntu1').
